but we only expose this one type.

declarations.comments:
`map domID latLng zoom` creates a new map object centered at `latLng`, at
zoom level `zoom`, and attaches it to the DOM element with ID `domID`.
declarations.title: map

declarations.comments: Tell a map that the size of its container may have changed, causing it to
declarations.title: invalidateSize

declarations.comments: Get the current zoom level.
declarations.title: getZoom

declarations.comments: Get the geographic position at which the map is currently centered.
declarations.title: getCenter

declarations.comments: Add a layer to a map
declarations.title: addLayer

declarations.comments: A URL template for tile layers.
declarations.title: UrlTemplate

declarations.comments:
Options to be passed to a tile layer at construction time. See
http://leafletjs.com/reference-1.0.3.html#tilelayer for an explanation of
each option.
declarations.title: TileLayerOption

declarations.comments:
`tileLayer template options` creates a new
[tile layer](http://leafletjs.com/reference-1.0.3.html#tilelayer) using
the URL template `template` to generate tile URLS.

The template can use the following variables, written between curly
braces:
- `{z}`: zoom level
- `{x}`, `{y}`: the tile coordinates (after projection), from the range
  `[0..(2 ^ z))`
- `{s}`: subdomain

Example: `"http://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"`
declarations.title: tileLayer

declarations.comments:
A zoom level. Zoom levels start at 0 (which means "show the whole world")
and zoom in exponentially, each step corresponding to a factor of 2.
declarations.title: Zoom

declarations.comments: A point in 2D screen space.
declarations.title: Point

declarations.comments: A distance in screen space, measured in logical pixels ("CSS Pixels").
declarations.title: Pixels

declarations.comments: Anything that uses Leaflet has a `LEAFLET` effect.
declarations.title: LEAFLET
